title: What are the significant contribution of Americans to the development of science, technology and society in the Philippines? - Quora

response.answer_text: What are the significant contribution of Americans to the development of science, technology and society in the Philippines? This is a loaded question. The conventional answer by fans of America may be naturally positive, stuff like education that would ripple into development of science and technology. Biased but indisputable. Objective observations may, however, include negative aspects of American contributions that may not ncessarily be anti-American in tenor. For instance, the huge military bases, Clark and Subic, now closed, may have made Filipinos aware of, but unable to copy, advanced strides in technology. Wind power has infantly come into being in the Ilocos, hydro power has been harvested in Mindanao, although still in a small scale, rice farming technology and research has been going on for decades, in spite of which, sadly, rice production is still wanting in fulfilling needs…

The United States or Americans have contributed greatly to the development of science and technology in the Philippines. The introduction of motorized vehicle was brought about by the Americans. The firearms was also brought about by the Americans.
